		<h1>TSMC’s 2nm Capacity Completely Sold Out At Two Local Plants For 2026, Production Output Target At 100,000 Monthly Wafers By Next Year</h1>

		<div class="meta">
			<div class="meta-author">
				<div><a href="https://wccftech.com/author/omarsohail/">Omar Sohail</a></div>

	<div class="content">

		
			<figure class="post-cover-wrap"><div class="post-cover wp-lightbox"><a href="https://cdn.wccftech.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/TSMC-3.jpg" rel="lightbox" aria-label="Cover image for the story"><img width="728" height="485" src="https://cdn.wccftech.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/TSMC-3-728x485.jpg" class="attachment-large size-large wp-post-image" alt="TSMC's two 2nm facilities have been completely booked" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://cdn.wccftech.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/TSMC-3-728x485.jpg 728w, https://cdn.wccftech.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/TSMC-3-541x360.jpg 541w, https://cdn.wccftech.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/TSMC-3-1456x969.jpg 1456w, https://cdn.wccftech.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/TSMC-3.jpg 1920w" sizes="(max-width: 728px) 100vw, 728px" /></a></div><figcaption>The first next-generation products are launching next year</figcaption></figure>
		

		<div class="advert">
			<div class="advert-mobile advert-300x250 mt-0 mb-2">
				<div id="div-gpt-ad-wccftechcom37749"></div>
			</div>	
		</div>


		<div class="post">

			<div class="story-share" data-nosnippet>
				<div id="share-facebook" class="share-single facebook"><svg width="20" height="20"><use xlink:href="#icn-shareFacebook"></use></svg></div>
				<div id="share-twitter" class="share-single twitter"><svg width="20" height="20"><use xlink:href="#icn-shareX"></use></svg></div>
				<div id="share-reddit" class="share-single reddit"><svg width="20" height="20"><use xlink:href="#icn-shareReddit"></use></svg></div>
				<div id="share-copylink" class="share-single copylink" data-url="https://wccf.tech/1it1h"><svg width="20" height="20"><use xlink:href="#icn-shareCopyLink"></use></svg></div>
				<span id="copylink-result" style="font-size: 1.1rem;"></span>
			</div>

			
			
			
			
			<p>As 2025 draws to a close, TSMC is about to <a href="https://wccftech.com/apple-secured-nearly-half-of-tsmc-2nm-wafer-supply-production-beginning-in-q4-2025/">press the button on 2nm production</a>, with a myriad of clients just waiting to get their hands on chip designs that have been mass produced on the next-generation lithography. Thanks to incredibly high demand for these wafers, the Taiwanese semiconductor manufacturing giant’s two facilities are completely booked for the entirety of 2026, with output slated to reach an impressive 100,000 monthly units next year.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="h-pilot-production-of-2nm-wafers-is-currently-underway-with-mass-production-reportedly-kicking-off-by-the-end-of-2025">Pilot production of 2nm wafers is currently underway, with mass production reportedly kicking off by the end of 2025</h2>



<p>The two 2nm production plants located in Hsinchu and Kaohsiung are yet to commence full-scale production, at least, according to <a href="https://x.com/dnystedt/status/1977532562479489206" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Dan Nystedt</a>, who states that both facilities are currently in the pilot manufacturing stages. The yields are said to be at 70 percent, which is puzzling to learn because TSMC’s trial production run that we talked about last year <a href="https://wccftech.com/tsmc-achieves-60-percent-yields-on-its-2nm-trial-production/">achieved a similar milestone</a>.</p>



<div id="" class="wccf_video_tag"><div class="d-none d-md-block"><div id="div-gpt-ad-wccftechcom37018"></div></div><div class="d-block d-md-none"><div id="div-gpt-ad-wccftechcom38145"></div></div></div><div id="" class="related-story"><a href="https://wccftech.com/nvidia-ceo-pushes-back-on-tsmc-shift/"><h5><strong>Related Story</strong> <span>NVIDIA CEO Pushes Back on “Shift” Narrative, Saying the U.S. Chip Production Target Requires TSMC to Add More Capacity, Rather Than Abandoning Taiwan</span></h5></a></div><p>Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo has commented that TSMC’s 2nm yield would be <a href="https://wccftech.com/tsmc-2nm-trial-production-yields-now-well-above-60-percent-claims-analyst/">higher than the figure achieved during the trial production run</a>, but according to the latest update, it remains at 70 percent. Also, the United Daily News report shared by Dan makes no mention of the 100,000 monthly output that would be achieved during mid-2026, but he states in his thread on X that TSMC’s advanced packaging capacity is also fully booked and can reach 150,000 monthly wafers next year.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-twitter wp-block-embed-twitter"><div class="wp-block-embed__wrapper">
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-width="500" data-dnt="true"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">TSMC is in the pilot production and validation phase of its 2nm process in two Taiwan locations, Fab 20 in Hsinchu (BaoShan) and Fab 22 in Kaohsiung, media report, with the yield rate nearly at 70%. Mass production is expected by year-end, with output increasing by mid-2026.…</p>— Dan Nystedt (@dnystedt) <a href="https://twitter.com/dnystedt/status/1977532562479489206?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">October 13, 2025</a></blockquote><script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script>
</div></figure>



<p>The report does not mention which TSMC customer has placed the biggest order, but we previously mentioned that Apple had <a href="https://wccftech.com/apple-secured-more-than-half-of-tsmc-2nm-production-to-starve-competition/">secured more than half of the initial 2nm capacity</a> to keep rivals like Qualcomm and MediaTek at bay. The first iteration of TSMC’s cutting-edge lithography is being referred to as N2, which will be followed by N2P. The price of each wafer is estimated to be a whopping $30,000.</p>

		wccfShare('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=' + encodeURIComponent(document.location.href), 600, 400);
		e.stopPropagation();
	}

	document.getElementById('share-twitter').onclick = function(e) {
		if (typeof gtag !== 'undefined') { gtag('event', 'share', { 'event_category': 'Twitter', 'event_label': document.location.href } ); }
		wccfShare( 'https://x.com/intent/post?url=' + document.location.href + '&text=' + encodeURIComponent(document.title), 600, 400 );
		e.stopPropagation();
	}

	document.getElementById('share-reddit').onclick = function(e) {
		if (typeof gtag !== 'undefined') { gtag('event', 'share', { 'event_category': 'Reddit', 'event_label': document.location.href } ); }
		wccfShare('https://www.reddit.com/submit?url=' + encodeURIComponent(document.location.href), 600, 500);
		e.stopPropagation();
	}
	
	document.getElementById('share-copylink').onclick = function(e) {
		if (typeof gtag !== 'undefined') { gtag('event', 'share', { 'event_category': 'Copy Link', 'event_label': document.location.href } ); }

		let url = document.getElementById('share-copylink').getAttribute('data-url');
		navigator.clipboard.writeText(url);

		document.getElementById('copylink-result').innerHTML = 'Copied!';
		setTimeout(function () { document.getElementById('copylink-result').innerHTML = ''; }, 2500); return false;

		e.stopPropagation();
	}

	var wrap = (query, tag, cls) => {
	  document.querySelectorAll( query ).forEach( elem => {
	    const div = document.createElement(tag);
	    div.classList.add(cls);
	    elem.parentElement.insertBefore(div, elem);
	    div.appendChild(elem);
	  });
	};

	//new SimpleLightbox({elements: '.wp-lightbox a'});
	
	wrap('iframe', 'div', 'iframe-wrapper');

	const tables = document.querySelectorAll(".post > table");

	tables.forEach(table => {
		const wrapper = document.createElement("div");
		wrapper.className = "table-wrapper";
		table.parentNode.insertBefore(wrapper, table);
		wrapper.appendChild(table);

		table.classList.add("tablepress");

		const button = document.createElement("button");
		button.innerHTML = `<svg height="14" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xml:space="preserve" version="1.1" style="shape-rendering:geometricPrecision; text-rendering:geometricPrecision;image-rendering:optimizeQuality;" viewBox="0 0 375 835" x="0px" y="0px" fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd"> <g> <path d="M363 304l-292 -292c-17,-16 -43,-16 -59,0 -16,16 -16,42 0,59l263 263 -263 263c-16,16 -16,43 0,59 16,16 42,16 59,0l292 -293c16,-16 16,-42 0,-59z" /> </g> </svg>`;
		button.className = "expand-btn";
		wrapper.appendChild(button);
	})

	const expandBtns = document.querySelectorAll(".expand-btn")

	expandBtns.forEach(btn => {
		btn.addEventListener('click', (e) => {
			btn.previousSibling.classList.toggle('expanded')
			//console.log("this is a table")
		})
	})
	
	window.addEventListener('click', function (event) {
		var sidenav = document.getElementById("sidenav");
		if (event.target == sidenav) {
			sidenav.classList.remove("active");
		}
	});
</script>
